setting.description: This setting controls if worldbuilder should continually render the scene to play animations. If this setting is off, animations will not play, but WorldBuilder will consume much less CPU power when the user is not changing the world.

Changing the World Scale will affect camera movement rates when working with this content. It is preferrable to establish a standard scale for all content and set the Toolbench user settings for camera movement to convenient values.

Indicates which D3D renderer to use. Valid targets are "DX9", "D3D10", and "D3D11". If the selected renderer can not be created, a DX9 renderer will be used. Setting takes effect when a renderer is created.
Sets a movement scale for the cameras in World Builder.
Turbo Scale controls how much faster the cameras in World Builder will move when [Shift] is pressed.
Sets the base keyboard movement rate of a camera in World Builder, measured in units per second. The actual rate = [Keyboard Base Movement] * [Movement Scale] * [PerContent World Scale].
Sets the base mouse movement rate of the camera in World Builder, measured in units per pixel. The actual rate = [Mouse Base Movement] * [Movement Scale] * [PerContent World Scale].
Look Sensitivity will effect the sensitivity of mouse look.
Controls if the camera should fly level when moved with WASD.
A value indicating if the default lights should be used to light the scene. This is only relevant at design time.
Toggles the display of the world grid.
Toggles the display of property visualization.
Directory containing custom shaders.
The color of minor lines in the world grid.
The color of major lines in the world grid.
The distance between minor world grid lines.
The distance between major world grid lines.
The distance to render the world grid in each direction.
Indicates if the vertical interval should be used when placing items on the grid.
Sets the vertical interval that the grid will appear at.
The default viewport layout. Valid values for the layout are 1 - 4. The number determines the number of visible viewports (1 - single viewport, 2 - two viewports split horizontally, and so on).
Toggles the active gizmo in the editor.
Toggles creation mode in the editor.
Toggles flipping of the translation gizmo to make sure each axis is visible.
